page.title: 12Transport
page.content: The area is provided with two forms of public transport that is trains and buses.The railway station is situated just to the north of the village of Swinderby still provides a regular train service.The line is the main Lincoln _ Nottingham route.The station is now unnmanned and tickets are obtained on a paytrain basis.There is a regular service to the east to Lincoln and to the west _ Newark and Nottingham.A regular bus service runs through the village.The main Manchester _ Lincoln express passes through twice daily.Other local services run at a two hourly frequency. The return fare from Swinderby to Lincoln on British Rail in 1985 is Â£1.40.The return fare by National Bus Company from Swinderby to Lincoln is Â£2.00.
